citeinfo.origin: Fisheries and Oceans Canada - Ocean Science And Productivity, Pacific
citeinfo.title: North American West Coast Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler (ADCP) data, 1996-present

descript.abstract: Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler data from many local and international locations. Largely experimental data collected in development of instrumentation. May be coordinated with other data collected, such as CTD, current meters, echo soundings, and meteorological buoys. Frequently collected in collaboration with other institutions.
descript.purpose: Study of upper ocean processes, wave breaking, bubbles, turbulence
descript.supplinf: Risk Justification: Principal investigator has left DFO, but the data are secure. Data are in electronic format, well backed up and well documented. Risk of Loss: Low Impact Justification: Data used for one time analysis. Data from experiments or data generated from models. Impact of Loss: Low Recommended Action: None

place.placekey: South Inner Coast (Johnstone, Georgia, JDF, inlets and passages)

idinfo.useconst: Data may be proprietary or under collaborative agreements. Largely experimental data.

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

dataqual.complete: Dataset Complications: Largely is experimental data. Electronic Data Complications: Tapes will degrade with time, the hardware and software required to extract the data may become obsolete.

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

digtinfo.formcont: Specialized hardware are required to extract the data; specialized software are required to read it.
